intro: Peritassa hatschbachii, commonly known as the Hawaiian peritassa, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in coastal habitats and is adapted to the unique climate of the Hawaiian Islands. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
